alert.note: Alert for Berks; Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 5:30PM EDT until September 07 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Berks County in eastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 530 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Churchtown, or near New Holland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Honey Brook, Elverson, New Morgan, Glenmoore and Flying Hills. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 308. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 8. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
